questions.question_text: Which service types can be managed through the scope of Service Portfolio Management? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Answer is B & C

Selected Answer: BC
bc is ok

Selected Answer: BC
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver - page 75
service portfolio managment: business service, technichal service.
it operations managment: application service.

Selected Answer: BC
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver - page 75

The two service types that are managed through Service Portfolio Management are:

* Technical service;

* Business service:

questions.question_text: Which is the process responsible for delivering items that have been ordered from a Service Catalog?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The Request Management Lifecycle:
1. Submission
2. Approval
3. Fulfilment
4. Closure


Answer is C

I believe it is E = Request Management
As per the ITSM Implementation book - after placing an order the request management process begins.

Selected Answer: C
servicenow documentation for Service Catalog request fulfillment:
When a user orders a catalog item, a request is created that follows a fulfillment process. A fulfillment process defines the steps to request approval, assign fulfillment tasks, and fulfill requests. Flow Designer flows, workflows, or execution plans are used to define fulfillment processes.

Selected Answer: C
The correct name is Service Catalog Request Fulfillment. So I think C is the closest.

Selected Answer: B
The service scope defines what is provided or not provided for a service. It sets clear boundaries and details about the service's capabilities, inclusions, exclusions, and limitations.

Selected Answer: B
"Service and Service Offerings Consist of one or mre service commitments that uniquely define the level of service in terms of availability, SCOPE, pricing, geographies, and/or packaging options."

Answer is B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Answer is B & E

questions.question_text: When using Catalog Builder, what can be built using templates? (Choose two.)
If a change model has Write roles AND Can write defined, which users have the ability to modify the change model record? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Users that have the Write role(s) AND match the Can write user criteria
choices.C: Users that have the Write role(s) OR that match the Can write user criteria

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Should be B+E

Selected Answer: BE
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver - page 395
b- as written in page 395: users with the admin or change_manager role may read and write any change model record.
e- as written in page 395: if a user does not have read/write access at the chg_model table level, then they will still not have any kind of access through read roles, write roles...

Selected Answer: BE
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver - page 395 
b- admin can do anything
e- as written in page 395: if a user does not have read/write access at the chg_model table level, then they will still not have any kind of access through read roles, write roles...

Selected Answer: AD
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver - page 386
update change record: 1.admin
2. itil_admin + itil
3. itil
4. sn_change_write
